material.mattext: What is the primary characteristic of digital voice communication?
What process converts an analog voice signal into a digital signal?
Which device is responsible for converting digital signals back into analog form?
What is the process of sampling an analog signal at regular intervals to create a digital signal called?
What term describes the number of samples taken per second during the digitization of an analog signal?
What is the unit of measure for sampling rate?
Which theorem states that the sampling rate must be at least twice the highest frequency of the analog signal to accurately represent it digitally?
What is quantization in the context of digital voice communication?
Mapping the amplitude of the signal to discrete levels
What is the main advantage of digital voice communication over analog communication?
Reduced susceptibility to noise and interference
Which type of digital modulation varies the amplitude of the carrier signal?
Which digital modulation technique uses two different frequencies to represent binary data?
What does the term "bit rate" refer to in digital communication?
The number of bits transmitted per second
The number of samples per second
The frequency of the carrier signal
Which component is used to encode and decode digital signals in digital communication systems?
What is the purpose of a digital signal processor (DSP) in digital voice communication?
To process and manipulate digital signals
To convert digital signals to analog
Which term describes the rate at which a digital communication system can transmit information?
What is the main disadvantage of digital communication compared to analog communication?
Which type of error detection method is commonly used in digital communication?
What is the purpose of error correction in digital communication?
To detect and correct errors in transmitted data
What does the term "jitter" refer to in digital communication?
Which technique is used to reduce the amount of data needed for digital voice communication?
What is the primary purpose of a digital filter in digital communication systems?
Which term describes the process of reconstructing an analog signal from its digital representation?
Which coding technique is used to represent a binary data stream as a series of discrete voltage levels?
What is the role of a modem in digital voice communication?
Modulate and demodulate signals for transmission over communication lines
Which of the following is an example of a digital communication protocol?
What is the main purpose of digital voice coding techniques?
To efficiently encode voice signals for transmission
To convert analog signals to digital
What does the term "bandwidth" refer to in digital communication?
The number of samples per second
The range of frequencies available for transmitting data
Which type of modulation technique combines amplitude and phase modulation?
Which term describes the delay between the transmission and receipt of a signal?
What is the primary function of a codec in digital voice communication?
To encode and decode digital signals
